intro: Lastreopsis effusa subsp. dilatata, commonly known as the broad-leaved lastreopsis, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
